Key Match Events: Christos Tzolis found himself in a one-on-one situation with Neuer but the goalkeeper pulled off a brilliant double save to keep the scoreline unchanged.
Julian Nagelsmann's troops came out all guns blazing in the second half and took just 10 minutes to score the equaliser.
Pascal Gross scored a stunner in the 89th minute to send the Greeks packing.
Post-Match Reflections: Although Neuer made a few sensational saves to keep the Greeks at bay throughout the match, his howler that led to the opener is concerning.

Havertz did enough to edge out the others for the MVP award, he worked tirelessly in attack, got into some really good positions to keep the centre-backs on their toes, and his equaliser to bring Germany back into the game meant that he ticked all the boxes that his manager would have wanted him to.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Neuer's mistake led to the opener
Germany will be in action against Scotland on June 14 in the Euro 2024 opener at Allianz Arean in Munich.
